Job Title: Kellogg Marine - Weekend Shift Supervisor

Location: Old Lyme, CT

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Management, Other

Description:
Are you ready for what’s next? 

Come explore opportunities within Brunswick, a global marine leader committed to challenging conventions and innovating next-generation technologies that transform experiences on the water and beyond. Brunswick believes “Next Never Rests™,” and we offer a variety of exciting careers and growth opportunities within united teams defining the future of marine recreation. 

Land 'N' Sea Distributing, Inc. is a full service, wholesale only distributor, serving the Marine and RV Industries for over 40 years. With thousands of different parts and accessories available from warehouses nationwide, Land 'N' Sea prides itself on fast, efficient delivery throughout the US and Canada. In a cooperative effort with Mercury Marine's Latin America and Caribbean division, Land 'N' Sea serves over 60 additional countries worldwide.

We are seeking an experienced Warehouse Shift Supervisor to join our Kellogg Marine team in Old Lyme, CT. The Weekend Shift Supervisor will work under the direction of the Branch Divisional Manager (BDM) to coordinate the daily activities of the warehouse operation, including but not limited to supporting the shipping and receiving leadership in the following areas: picking, packing, shipping, receiving, transferring, sanitation, safety and maintenance. Weekend Shift: Friday, Saturday, Sunday: 9am to 7pm, Monday: 11am to 9pm.

What you will be doing in the job: 

 Coordinate the scheduling of warehouse personnel to ensure proper staffing in order to complete multiple tasks at the facility in a calm, productive and cost-efficient manner Timely release and sort work to be processed with the defined priority.  Ensure work is processed in a timely and accurate manner to maximize our customer’s experience Recommend ways to improve warehouse productivity and accuracy.  Assist management in establishing budgets as needed, and adhere to budget requirements.  Report all IT issues immediately so a ticket can be created.  Work with the BDM and Day Warehouse Manager to ensure proper maintenance of the facilities, equipment and supplies; Communicate equipment needs and replacement requirements to management in order to upgrade and maintain warehouse productivity and efficiency Work with the BDM and Day Warehouse Manager to ensure Safety Program initiatives are enforced, providing a safe and clean workplace for employees, while remaining in compliance with OSHA, state and local requirements, as applicable Support and participate in the organization's Continuous Improvement Program Exercise the usual authority of a supervisor with regards to training, coaching, performance issues, timekeeping and career development Work with the BDM and Day Warehouse Manager regarding escalated performance issues and terminations, merit increases and performance appraisals, and promotions Perform other related duties as assigned by the BDM and/or divisional management

What skills you bring to our winning team: 

 Ability to multi-task, delegate responsibilities and oversee multiple priorities effectively Good verbal and written communication skills, across all levels of the organization Mediation and conflict resolution, and associated documentation Flexible schedule as required to fulfill business needs; Excellent attendance required

What experience/education you bring to our winning team: 

 High School diploma, college degree preferred Minimum 2-4 years experience in warehouse supervision, preferably in more progressive roles with a broad range of responsibilities Forklift and other material handling equipment experience This data is internal to Brunswick.  Computer experience (Word, Excel, email, etc) necessary, AS400 experience a plus Fleet Management and/or Hazmat experience a plus Experience supervising a team

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

WORKING CONDITIONS 

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk, bend, stoop, balance and use arms and hands to reach, pull, push, clasp and move a variety of materials. Walkways are concrete and/or metal grating. The employee must lift and/or move up to 50 pounds occasionally and up to 20 lbs frequently. Employee may be exposed to high, precarious places. The warehouse environment can be hot (or cold) and dusty.

Next is Now!

We value growth and development, recognizing that people come with a wealth of experience and talent beyond just the technical requirements of a job. If your experience is close to what you see listed here, please still consider applying. Diversity of experience and skills combined with passion is a key to innovation and inspiration. Therefore, we encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our positions. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the interview process. 

Equal Opportunity Employer: Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

EEO is The Law - click here for more information

Brunswick and Workday Privacy Policies

Brunswick does not accept applications, inquiries or solicitations from unapproved staffing agencies or vendors. For help, please contact our support team at: hrsharedservices@brunswick.com or 866-278-6942.

All job offers will come to you via the candidate portal you create when applying through a posted position through https:///www.brunswick.com/careers. If you are ever unsure about what is being required of you during the application process or its source, please contact HR Shared Services at 866-278-6942 or HRSharedServices@brunswick.com.

#Brunswick Corporation - Mercury Marine

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
